review_title: Working at Mount St. Mary's University
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Frederick, MD
pros: Work with some wonderful, caring people.  The campus embodies the Christian way of living and the students are great.
cons: The pay is barely a liveable wage.  Top heavy University with upper echelon making a lot of money while the rest of the employees struggle to make enough to live on.  No follow through when complaining about problems and issues.  Very frustrating - I feel invisible but expected to continue to do more and more work for no pay raise.

pros: If you live in the area, it keeps you from having to commute to Frederick, DC, Baltimore, Harrisburg, etc. Most of the staff is friendly and I made some great friendships there, lots of events for employees and freebies. Tons of paid holidays.
cons: Little room for advancement and growth, lots of "lifers" with poor attitudes. Sometimes leadership "over-reaches" given the school's size and location. Just be what you are! Plenty of gossip...can be hard working there as a non-Catholic with some of the policies, especially with health insurance.

pros: Number of vacation days and paid holidays.  Tuition exchange if you get it.  The best days are the ones you don't have to go there!
cons: Too many people in top administration, many who aren't knowledgeable enough to be making the decisions they are making.  Many employees are grossly underpaid.  It's all about money.  Very inconsistent operating procedures.   Many higher level employees do whatever they want.

review_title: Great small, private college with friendly, professional and brilliant faculty, staff and administration
pros: Strong, close-knit community that encourages everyone from its' students to its' faculty, staff and administration.
cons: Located in a small town in a mountain area--a bit remote.  Can be a bit political at times, but they are always working to make it a better place for everyone.

pros:
free room which saved about $3,000
training  three times around
team effort
great experience
gained respect on campus
management willing to help
cons:
-very very very very very cliquish
-some people take this position title to their heads and become like a flashlight cop looking for the wrong in people
-they lie and say you have a choice where you are placed but you really dont

pros: Everyone on campus is friendly and outgoing. Professors know you by your first name and are always reachable. The president of the university is always on campus reaching out to the students and actively engages in campus activities.
cons: Some of the university's offices lack proper leadership. They are disorganized and aren't benefiting the students.

pros: Good insurance, free college through them and as well as sister schools, PTO racks up nicely.
cons: Pay could be much better and no room to grow or make more money later. A lot of overworked and underpaid workers.

review_title: No way this university survives long term
pros: Still some good people that work there and relatively down to earth students.  Beautiful location.
cons:
Annual budget cuts 
Blind eye turned to toxic employee culture 
Lip service paid to diversity 
Overly complicated and unrealistic strategic plan
Talking a big game with little ability to deliver 
A lot of great people and programs are leaving

job_title: Clubs Sport Administrative Supervisor in Emmitsburg, MD
pros: The people I worked with, and for, were supportive and encouraged growth. Direction was readily available when needed, but you were pushed to become independent.
cons: There are no cons that I am able to come up with.

pros: Amazing healthcare, 18 paid holiday's, flexible time off, 10 month or 12 month employment options, traditional M-F schedule.
cons: Pay leaves something to be desired.  Not getting promoted unless someone retires.
